topic.title: Reusable Components for both Web Author/WA Customization

li.p: Click Upload Framework and choose a framework to upload. You can enable the Validate frameworks option to trigger a process that validates the framework during the upload and also when the framework is loaded after a restart.The framework should be a ZIP or JAR archive that contains exactly one folder. This folder should contain the framework descriptor file (with a .framework or .exf extension) and other supporting files. If the uploaded archive does not have this format you will receive an error that the upload was rejected. If the folder contains both a .framework and .exf file, the .framework file will be used.
Step Result: The framework should appear in the list on this Frameworks page. Uploaded frameworks appear with a light green highlight so that you can easily identify them.

ol.li: Once you are finished with all of your changes, restart the server.

dd.p: Use this option to activate application-level authentication to only allow authenticated users access to the application. This will significantly enhance the application's security, protecting against potential attacks (e.g. denial-of-service attacks). Possible providers include GitHub, GitLab, and GitLab Enterprise, but it is important to note that they are only available if configured (see Integrating Web Author with GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket).
You can also utilize the Oxygen XML Web Author REST plugin to integrate with a CMS or file server and it includes authentication support. In this case, you would choose CMS for the provider.
dd.note: Web Author also supports OIDC as an application authentication.

dlentry.dd: If selected, HTTPS connections with invalid certificates will be rejected. If not selected, security certificates are accepted, even if they are invalid.

dlentry.dt: Use the "Secure" attribute for the session cookie
dlentry.dd: If selected, the "Secure" cookie attribute will be added on the session cookie. This means that the browser will only send the session cookie over HTTPS (if enabled).Do not enable this option unless Web Author is accessed only over HTTPS.

If selected, the Strict-Transport-Security header that makes browsers access the application's domain will be set using only HTTPS protocol (including subdomains).Do not set this option unless all the applications hosted on the DNS domain where Web Author is hosted and the applications on the subdomains of this domain are hosted only over HTTPS. Applications that use HTTP instead of HTTPS and are hosted on the DNS domain of Web Author and its subdomain will not work for Web Author users after you enable this setting.
